Articles.Content:
Spacedock: DaMichel's AeroRadial (DAR)
Spacedock: DaMichel's CargoBays (DCB)
Spacedock: DaMichel's Fuselage (DMF)
Spacedock: DaMichel's SphericalTanks (DST)

 

DaMichel's Parts (DMP)

Available separately or as one big pack.

    
    
    
    

Agent, flags, and common files
   

Parts Pack (all the above)

    

 

SphericalTanks

  • Parts mod with five SphericalTanks with 1.25 m base from 0.625 to 10 t. (612.5L - 10,000L)
  • Five (5) 1.25m spherical tanks. Available in veteran orange.

CargoBays

  • A payload parts mod that adds three 2.5m round cargobays in 1m, 2m, and 4m lengths with fold-flat door design.
  • Three (3) 2.5m rocket cargo bays in 1m, 2m, and 4m lengths. Flat fold doors.

AeroRadial

  • An electrical parts mod adding two streamlined radially attached parts: one RTG and one Fuel Cell.
  • Two (2) streamlined, radially attached power products. One RTG, the other a Liquid Fuel and Intake Air powered fuel cell.

Fuselage

  • An aero parts mod adding adding seven (7) stock-alike flat fuselage parts.
  • Seven (7) flat fuselage pieces.

This is a continuation of DaMichel's Part Pack.

Images:

https://postimg.cc/gallery/1ds2abwku/

updates

reserved for current release notes:

DaMichel's Parts Version 1.1.0.0 - Fresh Coat of Paint

zer0Kerbal released this 2020 02 17

Packs / Versions:

Version 1.1.0.0 - Fresh Coat of Paint

  • adopted for curation by zer0Kerbal
  • for Kerbal Space Program (KSP) 1.9 (might work for earlier)
  • converted to use Localization - translations welcomed through GitHub Push Request
  • updated license to CC BY-NC-SA 3.0
  • file structure and modernization
  • added Kerbal Changelog
  • added Readme
  • created github repo
  • created SpaceDock entry
  • created CKAN entry
  • created Curseforge entry
  • created Forum post
  • created .json
  • modernized part.cfg
  • added DM-RFC (Radial Fuel Cell) - which is an air breathing, liquid fuel powered generator producing 1.5 EC/s
  • added ODFC patch
  • created DM-RFC texture
  • many little changes to patches/parts.

Kerbal Space Program 1.8.1

Kerbal Space Program 1.8.1

Now available through Spacedock (and CKAN shortly)

Spacedock: DaMichel's AeroRadial (DAR)

Spacedock: DaMichel's Fuselage (DMF)
Spacedock: DaMichel's SphericalTanks (DST)

Edited February 19, 2020 by zer0Kerbal

I vaguely remember the fuselage parts from the old days of KSP when I started using mods. I wanted to try them, but they were swallowed up by the forum and I wasn't able to find them again. I guess better late than never right? 

Ooo… spherical tanks that aren't associated with USI, now I have to start playing with those.

PS. After looking at the configs, you may want to raise the crash tolerance and decrease the max temp to bring them more inline with the stock parts.

2 hours ago, shdwlrd said:

I vaguely remember the fuselage parts from the old days of KSP when I started using mods. I wanted to try them, but they were swallowed up by the forum and I wasn't able to find them again. I guess better late than never right? 

Ooo… spherical tanks that aren't associated with USI, now I have to start playing with those.

PS. After looking at the configs, you may want to raise the crash tolerance and decrease the max temp to bring them more inline with the stock parts.

Yes. all four of these are seemingly fairly popular on SpaceDock.

I would love to see the flat fuselage in say carbon fiber black, and maybe some blinkies on them - @bcink or another modeler might take some of their very precious time to update the models. (I can hope).

I will see if I can provide the SphericalTanks with other selectable textures. Am also considering releasing them in 0.625m, 1.875m, 2.5m, and 3.75m variants. What do you think?

I welcome suggestions. all github PR's will be considered.

Thank you - +1  

the Factory Specified maxTemp has been raised due to additional post release testing from 1800° to 2000° in order to bring it in line with our competitors.

the crashTolerance of DaMichel's 1.25m SphericalTanks is 7, which is why you pay a premium for them.

compared to similar stock tanks.

  • Spoiler
    • R-11 'Baguette' External Tank
      • crashTolerance = 5
    • Oscar-B Fuel Tank
      • crashTolerance = 6
    • FL-T100 Fuel Tank
      • crashTolerance = 6
    • Rockomax X200-8 Fuel Tank
      • crashTolerance = 6

the breakingForce and breakingTorque had already been corrected to 50 (stock) from 200 (unbreakium)

in researching this - several other small details came up and will be fixed in the next release (the texture was fixed already):

Spoiler

        version = 1.1.0.1
        change = changed maximum_drag from 0.25 to 0.2 (stock)
        change = minimum_drag from 0.25 to 0.3 (stock)
        change = maxTemp from 1800 (originally was 1400) to 2000 (stock)
        change = added missing texture (c125-normalmap_NRM.dds)
        change = updated integrated TweakScale module (removed KGEx, added freeScale = True)
Jez @zer0Kerbal it seems like you've just exploded with quantity of mods lately. You trying to give Linuxgurugamer a run for his money as the master mod maintainer?

5 hours ago, vardicd said:

Jez @zer0Kerbal it seems like you've just exploded with quantity of mods lately. You trying to give Linuxgurugamer a run for his money as the master mod maintainer?  

not trying... however, I do have a backlog of mods to release - last count 20+ (mostly part mos) including some real favorites.

Hopefully they are quality not just quantity.

Next up: SimpleCargoSolutions; and maybe some long legs, and maybe a whole lotta ISP.

Edited February 19, 2020 by zer0Kerbal

Thanks for taking on these mods. It might be nice to put the descriptions that are on the respective Spacedock pages in the OP here, because as it is, it is not necessarily obvious what these parts bring to the game.

Edit: Also, 3 of the mods (DMF, DST and DAR) are marked on Spacedock as being for 1.8.1, although the description says they are for 1.9.0. You may want to update this

Edited February 19, 2020 by Joal ban Kluane
additional comment

2 hours ago, Joal ban Kluane said:

Thanks for taking on these mods. It might be nice to put the descriptions that are on the respective Spacedock pages in the OP here, because as it is, it is not necessarily obvious what these parts bring to the game.

Edit: Also, 3 of the mods (DMF, DST and DAR) are marked on Spacedock as being for 1.8.1, although the description says they are for 1.9.0. You may want to update this

My pleasure.

excellent suggestion. +1

CKAN also lists all four as compatible with 1.9; which they probably are, however I haven't even started up 1.9 yet. I have downloaded it; but soon™ I will fire it up. Once I do, and at least see that the parts pop, I will release for 1.9.

Thankfully I was shown an easy way to speed up my deployment by using .json's - thank you for pointing out the issue - I just updated the KSP.json for these parts and violai it now should be updated everywhere, at least on all the graphical. I can't do much about CargoBays on Spacedock.

I appreciate the feedback!

PS - I just updated the OP with your suggestion.

5 errors related to SphericalTanks/Patches/B9FuelSwitch-Karbonite.cfg

is there any importance into this or not? @zer0Kerbal

I welcome suggestions. all github PR's will be considered.

is there any importance into this or not? @zer0Kerbal

 

1 hour ago, zer0Kerbal said:

more news @11.

news came early:

I will try to release  version 1.1.0.1 later today/tomorrow. the repo has been updated.

Spoiler

- updated localization from #DM_sphericaltanks_* to #DST_*
- B9TankTypes.cfg to add in Karbonite an Karborundum tank definitions | unitsPerVolume probably need adjustment (currently set to 5) (seems there is a 5:1 ratio between LF and K)
- added new tank patch (Karborundum) if B9PartSwitch and Karbonite+ (Karborundum) is installed
- added localization from new B9TankTypes and new patch into localization
- updated existing B9PartSwitch Karbonite patch
- added USI-Logistics to tanks if USI-Logistics installed.
- removed extraneous [SNACKS] in B9FuelSwitch-Snacks.cfg
- removed extraneous [TAC] in B9FuelSwitch-TAC-LS.cfg
- split Karborundum out of B9FuelSwitch-Karbonite.cfg into its own patch: B9FuelSwitch-Karborundum.cfg
- looking at volumes between USI, DST, and stock - something is out of whack. Not Sphericaltanks (appears to be USI-Kontainers holding about 10% more than mathimatically possible)
Hey, there were some problems with the Kerbal Changelog .cfg file formatting, I've submitted a PR to fix those for you.

11 hours ago, Benjamin Kerman said:

Hey, there were some problems with the Kerbal Changelog .cfg file formatting, I've submitted a PR to fix those for you.

Thank you!

+1

merged. will try to release 1.1.0.1 later today.
I had almost forgotten those weird old intakes! -- no to mention the engine nozzles.

Congratulations on the release. 

I'm curious how these are balanced compared to stock parts?

On 2/19/2020 at 12:48 AM, vardicd said:

Jez @zer0Kerbal it seems like you've just exploded with quantity of mods lately. You trying to give Linuxgurugamer a run for his money as the master mod maintainer?  

I'm quite happy that @zer0Kerbal is picking up the parts mods. I may toss a few his way which I haven't had time to update.

Congratulations on the release. 

I'm curious how these are balanced compared to stock parts?

almost spot on for the Mk1 parts, the max temps are a little high.

2 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Congratulations on the release. 

I'm curious how these are balanced compared to stock parts?

thank you @linuxgurugamer!

the tanks should be spot on - in most regards. see posts above for slight changes suggested and will be addressed when I push out the next release soon™.

the AeroRadial should be spot on - at least the production part.

The Flat Fuselage - should also be close.

Cargobays should also be close

If you see something, kindly say something. and as always, PR's welcome.

 

I spent the day working on some, um, mods, that fell into my lap and tracking down the licenses/permissions for others.

1 hour ago, linuxgurugamer said:

I'm quite happy that @zer0Kerbal is picking up the parts mods. I may toss a few his way which I haven't had time to update.

all good. I know one or two that come to mind that you might not enjoy all that much.

49 minutes ago, shdwlrd said:

almost spot on for the Mk1 parts, the max temps are a little high.

thank you.

what would you suggest?

I would expect them to be a little higher because IIRC 90° angles radiate better - or do I have that backwards? 90° angles are bad in circuitry and fluid dynamic flows....

26 minutes ago, zer0Kerbal said:

what would you suggest?

Most of the Mk1/Size 1 parts have a max temp of 1400-2000. I was thinking of matching the Mk1 fuselage parts and making them 1800. If you seen my GitHub suggestion, I explain my though process there.

3 hours ago, Beetlecat said:

I had almost forgotten those weird old intakes! -- no to mention the engine nozzles.

Man that's an old design. Haven't seen those parts in forever.

41 minutes ago, zer0Kerbal said:

I would expect them to be a little higher because IIRC 90° angles radiate better - or do I have that backwards? 90° angles are bad in circuitry and fluid dynamic flows

For radiating, Im pretty sure its the exposed surface area that is important, not the angles.

Posting changes as they happen here.

First part up:

 DMfuselage-intake
- has the same specs as the Ram Air Intake.

Spoiler 

## DMfuselage-intake - has the same specs as the Ram Air Intake.
	TechRequired = highAltitudeFlight
	entryCost = 14000 // was 1600
	cost = 2680 // was 2000

	mass = 0.125 // stock part 0.06
	dragModelType = default
	maximum_drag = 0.3
	minimum_drag = 0.3
	angularDrag = 1
	crashTolerance = 7
	breakingForce = 200 // was 50
	breakingTorque = 200 // was 50
	maxTemp = 2000 // was 2900
	thermalMassModifier = 12.0 // added
	// heatConductivity = 0.06  // added // half default
	buoyancy = 0.1  // added

	explosionPotential = 0.5  // added
	
		MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleResourceIntake
		resourceName = IntakeAir
		checkForOxygen = true
		area = 0.01
		intakeSpeed = 10
		intakeTransformName = intakeTransform
 // added
		machCurve
		{
			key = 0 0.85 0 0
			key = 1 1 0 0
			key = 2 0.95 -0.08751557 -0.08751557
			key = 4 0.5 -0.4034287 -0.4034287
			key = 8 0.01 0 0
		 }
	}

	RESOURCE
	{
		name = IntakeAir
		amount = 2.0 // was 0.2
		maxAmount = 2.0 // was 0.2
	}
